file_content.text: What? I didn't do nothing.
Why are you always looking at me? Don't you trust me yet?
Have I said "thank you" yet? If not, just remind me, and I will. Twice a day. Like atmospheric suppositories.
I mean, most women aren't so forgive-and-forget....
I mean, most guys, they'd have killed me without a second thought....
I, ah, probably shouldn't keep reminding you not to trust me.
I'm counting on you to be so helpful that I forget all about it.
Make me forget.
Ha! That's a good one. For a second there, I thought you were serious.
Believe me, it's not something I'll forget.
I don't need a reminder.
All right. All right. You don't need to spell it out.
By the way, can you tell that Corso guy to maybe see a doctor about his snoring? How does anyone sleep on this ship?
Are you going somewhere with this, or just blathering?
Get to the point.
Just blathering. I do that a lot. Especially when I'm nervous. You might have noticed.
Is this the whole ship? I thought it would be bigger.
Just, ah, tell me if you need anything, Captain. I'll be on the comlink, trying to order some decent food....
Tell me everything you know about Rogun the Butcher.
Let's talk Rogun.
Right to business, huh? He's a strange guy, Rogun, got his own kind of honor.
I think he gets off on the whole underworld anti-hero image.
Freedom to thumb his nose at any authority on any planet. You'd like him... if he wasn't trying to kill you.
I'm not getting past that part.
But he is trying to kill me.
Don't get me wrong. They're not lying when they say he froze his heart in carbonite so it wouldn't get in his way....
Just don't think you can play him with the usual tricks. He's smart and he's mean and he's good.
He's really gone deep cover? Didn't think the Empire gave their agents much freedom.
Weird trait for an Imperial.
I never tried to get under the covers with the guy, but if the gangster thing's just an act, he plays it really well.
When we land planetside, you get a room somewhere, right? You don't expect us to keep sleeping in these closets--? Never mind....
I'm not looking to date the guy. Just tell me where he keeps his stashes!
Give me something useful.
If I had anything good, I'd have ripped them off myself. But I'll give you what I know.
This is your nav computer? I thought you'd have something good!
Captain, I just wanted to say "thank you."
I could never have imagined you would put up with me for this long.
When I first came on board with you, I thought it was going to be a few weeks at most before you left me on some isolated moon.
Keep me laughing, and you've got a bunk on this ship forever.
You're a hoot.
Have you heard this one? "There once was a Mon Cal from Dac. He wore a jetpack on his back...."
"He liked to shoot blasters, and fly even faster. He was a Mando-Cal attack."
No? Well, I'll come up with a better one. You're like my family, Captain. No one else has ever given me the kind of trust and respect I've had here.
Once you're in my crew, you're family.
I would never do that.
Aww, Captain... you'll make me cry.
Seriously, though. This is my family. More than the Jedi. More than the one I was born to. I've never been able to be myself anywhere like I have with you.
I'll never leave you.
Never say never.
Still could happen.
I know you better than that. Tough facade, but underneath, you're all heart.
I've never been anywhere that I got the kind of trust and respect I have from you and the rest of the crew.
You're like my family! I just know we'll all be together forever!
You know, you're the kind of gal you know when she's mad. And you know when you've made her laugh.
You're the kind of guy, you know where you stand. Either you're laughing or you're shooting.
I would have done much better with someone like you.
Master Lorenn was just ice. You had no idea if he even knew you were in the room.
The fart jokes are a dead giveaway.
You're hard to miss.
Yeah, Master Lorenn hated those... if I'd been able to make him laugh, I wouldn't have had to be such a wretch.
But you know, you say "hello," you get back, "study more." Then you go release Kowakian monkey-lizards in the Masters' mess.
That's just how it goes.
If I could, I'd teach you what to do with that lightsaber.
I like you too, kid.
Aw, Captain....
If you were my Master, I might have practiced.
Or at least not released the Kowakian monkey-lizards into your dressing room... maybe that was a bad plan....
Are you still moping about your old Jedi stuff?
Get over him, already.
Oh, sorry, should I be dancing to hear that the first guy who thought I was worth spit is locked up on some Sith prison ship?
I'll go work on the choreography!
They should make every Jedi kid spend time in a war zone.
When you see what real Sith are like, it makes my blood run cold. And don't make any fish jokes there--I'm serious.
It makes you see why the Jedi make such a big deal about not giving in to the dark side.
Isn't "don't give in to the dark side" kind of Jedi school 101?
You're just realizing this?
I never thought I was the type. You know, like all Sith had to be these brooding, sadistic puppet masters.
Thinking about going back?
It sounds like you miss it.
I am. But right now, I'm in your crew and I can't ask for anything better.
I can't imagine you as a Sith.
Nobody is worried about you.
That's what I thought. You have to be a scheming, sadistic puppet-master, right?
But Master Lorenn was right, the road to the dark side starts with things we all feel: jealousy, greed. They're all the seeds of it.
I'd rather spend the rest of my life meditating on a cold rock than turn into that.
I need you to teach me to fight dirty.
You'd think I'd be good at that, you know? But when it gets beyond cowering in doorways, I'm pretty much all point-and-shoot.
Show me how you work your magic.
Set your blaster on stun. We'll take some time and see what you're made of.
All right.
Stun. Huh. That's a good idea....
I usually aim below the belt.
Just hit them where it hurts.
I hear that works really well on humans....
No offense, but I'd rather see you as non-lethal as possible.
No.
Fine. I think I've learned a lot just from watching you.
So, have I been looking any more convincing with the lightsaber?
I mean, it's about as much use to me in a fight as a glow-in-the-dark belt buckle, but I figure if I wave it around, maybe it'll scare people off.
You think you can get me one of those?
Nice!
I'll keep my eye out.
I haven't noticed anyone running in fear at the sight of you, no.
Hasn't worked so far.
Well, you've got to admit, the people who attack us aren't generally very concerned about, well, living.
If you can't use the lightsaber, you should return it to the Jedi, where it can do some good.
You should give it back.
Making me feel like an enormous glowing symbol of virility isn't good?
This was the only lightsaber we had, you know, in the whole enclave. I wasn't in the Jedi Academy proper--never made it that far.
My Master ran a recruitment center on Nar Shaddaa. I don't think he had the guts to actually bring me out in public.
Doesn't sound like much of a life.
Not a good memory?
It was a step up from prison.
I thought all Jedi trained at the Academy.
A Jedi recruitment center?
There's always a few who slip through the cracks.
Unless you know something that will blast me to component atoms, make me a ton of credits, or both, keep your mouth shut.
I don't want to hear it.
I hear you.
That's the best thing about you. You don't waste time with pointless conversations. If it's not important, it's just not on your radar. You....
Shutting up now.
I guess you've been wondering how someone like me ever ended up with the Jedi, huh?
You don't really seem like the Jedi type.
I'd thought about it.
They thought that, too.
It's the duty of the Jedi to train anyone Force sensitive, so they don't fall to the dark side.
The Jedi take in everyone.
Boy, you've picked up the party line....
I really don't think about you that much.
Never considered it.
I was always kind of the odd one out in my family. And believe me, it was not a small family.
When they kicked me out, I went to Nar Shaddaa... and met a Jedi who said all the weird stuff that happens to me is a connection to the Force.
Don't sell yourself short. You do plenty of weird stuff all on your own.
Not all the weird stuff.
And you know, that was an issue.
The Jedi are all about recruiting kids too young to know better, so there it was, me and all these serene little kids.
That must have been amazing.
How did that make you feel?
At first. I was imagining myself winning lightsaber duels, getting revenge on all the kids who laughed at me.
But it turns out revenge isn't part of the Jedi lifestyle.
You've never known real rage until you've been lectured on controlling your emotions by a four-year-old in a robe.
You said you were kicked out?
What happened?
I maybe overstated that. They don't really throw people out, you know. Call of the dark side and all that.
But it was clear I'd never make the cut. Anything I could do with the Force was basically random.
Would it have been better not to know?
Are you saying you regret it?
Hey, without my old Master, I'd still be picking pockets on Nar Shaddaa.
But, yeah, sometimes those might-have-beens get a little bitter, you know?
Never even figured out how to work his old lightsaber....
Avoid sanctimonious Jedi brats. Noted.
I'll take your word for it.
The kids were prigs, but at least they didn't pity me. The way my Master used to look at me....
I couldn't spend my life being the Jedi class clown, you know? It was obvious I wasn't going to master the Force.
Never even figured out how to work my dead Master's lightsaber....
Go tell your endearing anecdotes to someone who gives a womp rat's behind.
I don't care.
B--but... you're the best friend I've ever had.
I was going to tell you about my life, and we'd go on a trip around the galaxy to fix my problems.
And you'd give me gifts and I'd swear my undying loyalty and... it could still happen!
So what was it like? Nok Drayen? I've been asking Risha, but she gets all weird and prickly about it.
She actually walked out when I said that it'd make a better story if you turned out to be Nok Drayen's long-lost daughter or something.
She actually slapped me when I said it'd be a better story if you turned out to be his long-lost son.
Even Rogun was impressed when he heard you'd dug up the old man's treasures.
What did Rogun say about me?
Talk about Rogun.
Well, it started with the blasters, but mostly he got mad after you dodged his assassins. It was a pride thing.
Then when you hooked up with the lady Senator--hoooh, he hated her. He was after you just to get you out of her hands.
But none of this is news. I want to hear about you!
I don't like to brag, but... oh, who am I kidding. I love to brag!
I'm very impressive.
That's why everyone's heard of you, right?
Are you trying to butter me up?
What do you want?
I just want to know everything about you.
How does someone become the most famous spacer in the galaxy, anyway?
Did you always know this was what you wanted to do? I like to imagine your parents programmed janitorial droids, and this was your way out of the family business.
I sort of fell into this lifestyle--not that I'm complaining. The money's good.
This wasn't planned.
Can't ask for better, kid. Complete strangers give you credits to have the time of your life.
I love being free.
I wish my old Jedi Master could meet you. He'd have a harder time selling the whole "deprivation is the key to happiness" thing.
Yes. That's it exactly.
Quit prying.
Really? That's incredible. Did you mention something once? Otherwise I don't know how I would have....
Oh. Right. I'll stop asking.
Can we talk, Captain? Somewhere private maybe? Like the ship?
Do you have a second? I promise it's something important. Well, to me, anyway...
Sorry, Captain. I got nothing for you... Unless you want to hear that story about juggling lightsabers in my underwear again...
Sounds like my life... except for the good money part. Guess it's too late to discuss salary, huh?
Fair point.
I'm all yours now, Captain.
You need your own sail barge? I know a Hutt who's selling cheap....
I--I think I'm gonna... blarg!
No. No way. I'm not being bait. Not this time.
I hear you.
I'll keep my eye out.
I'll never leave you.
I could never have imagined you would put up with me for this long.
